evidence.text: The Taj Mahal Palace is a heritage, five-star, luxury hotel in the Colaba area of Mumbai, Maharashtra, India, situated next to the Gateway of India. Built in the Indo-Saracenic style, it opened in 1903 as the Taj Mahal Hotel and has historically often been known simply as "The Taj". The hotel is named after the Taj Mahal, which is located in the city of Agra approximately 1,050 kilometres (650 mi) from Mumbai. It has been considered one of the finest hotels in the East since the time of the British Raj. The hotel was one of the main targets in the 2008 Mumbai attacks.
evidence.title: Taj Mahal Palace Hotel

evidence.text: The Taj Mahal is an ivory-white marble mausoleum on the right bank of the river Yamuna in Agra, Uttar Pradesh, India. It was commissioned in 1631 by the fifth Mughal emperor, Shah Jahan, to house the tomb of his beloved wife, Mumtaz Mahal; it also houses the tomb of Shah Jahan himself. The tomb is the centrepiece of a 17-hectare (42-acre) complex, which includes a mosque and a guest house, and is set in formal gardens bounded on three sides by a crenellated wall.

The History Behind the Taj Mahal The story of the Taj Mahal starts with the love between Emperor Shah Jahan and his wife Mumtaz Mahal. Mumtaz was Shah Jahan's preferred wife, known for her splendor, compassion, and intelligence. Tragically, she died in 1631 at the same time as giving delivery to their fourteenth baby. Heartbroken, Shah Jahan vowed to create a monument as stunning as his spouse and started constructing the Taj Mahal to honor her reminiscence. Construction of the Taj Mahal began in 1632 and took over 20 years to complete, regarding thousands of artisans and craftsmen from across Asia. The end result turned into an architectural masterpiece that combined elements from Islamic, Persian, Ottoman, and Indian architectural styles. The Taj Mahal has because been identified as one of the New Seven Wonders of the World, drawing hundreds of thousands of visitors each yr. 2. Architectural Marvel and Design The Taj Mahal is well known for its wonderful symmetry, difficult detailing, and airy beauty. Designed by the architect Ustad Ahmad Lahauri, the primary shape is built from white marble that adjustments colour relying on the time of day, transferring from a smooth crimson at dawn to glowing white in the afternoon, and a golden hue within the moonlight. This play of light enhances its mystical appeal and undying elegance. The central dome of the Taj Mahal rises 240 toes and is flanked with the aid of 4 smaller domes, developing a harmonious stability. Four narrow minarets, one at every nook, frame the structure, including to its symmetry. The important chamber homes the tombs of Mumtaz Mahal and Shah Jahan, although those are definitely symbolic cenotaphs; the actual graves are in a decrease chamber. The marble is inlaid with semi-valuable stones, such as jade, turquoise, and lapis lazuli, forming complex floral designs. This inlay paintings, referred to as pietra dura, is one of the Taj Mahal’s defining functions, demonstrating the high-quality craftsmanship that went into its production. Three.
